thread.title: U.N. blacklists dozens of ships, companies over North Korea smuggling

title: U.N. blacklists dozens of ships, companies over North Korea smuggling
text:
March 30, 2018 / 7:53 PM / Updated 35 minutes ago U.N. blacklists dozens of ships, companies over North Korea smuggling Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
UNITED NATIONS (Reuters) - A United Nations Security Council committee blacklisted 21 shipping companies, 27 ships and one individual on Friday over illegal North Korean oil and coal smuggling. 
The U.N. Security Council has unanimously boosted sanctions on North Korea since 2006 in a bid to choke off funding for Pyongyangâ€™s nuclear and ballistic missile programs, banning exports including coal, iron, lead, textiles and seafood, and capping imports of crude oil and refined petroleum products. Reporting by Michelle Nichols; Editing by Sandra Maler
